description.narrative: The aim (2030) of the new Climate Resilience (CR) Unit is that thriving rural communities enjoy their rights and achieve food security and resilience to climate change and other shocks, while sustainably managing diverse natural resources. The core objective of the Unit is the empowerment of women and men, youth and indigenous peoples that live in rural areas and that are mostly affected by food insecurity, climate change and degradation of their environment. This project aims to development a frameworkfor a People's Landscape Approach in the specific context of Climate Resilience, that - takes into account the blending of indigenous/local knowledge/practice with science and technology, as well as climate risk-based/informed planning, budgeting, and implementation to maximize adaptation benefits for local livelihoods - entails the underlying principles and characteristics of Oxfam and its partners, - describesthe policy issues to be involved at local, provincial and federal level - outlines the added value of Oxfam and its partners, basedon the existing track record and proven approaches, tools and methodologies. - describes the way these approaches, tools and methodologies can best be used, adjusted and/or completed (probably in a modular way). This framework will serve as a basis for alliance building and future program development on People’s Landscapes, integrating existing, tested and documented Oxfam approaches and learnings.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: Communities innovate and implement locally owned solutions for climate adaptation and resilience, with recognition of the specific needs and aspirations of women, men and youth.
CBOs and NGO's resourced to innovate and implement locally owned solutions, recognizing specific needs and aspirations of women, men and youth

CBOs, producer organisations, NGO and other civil society actors with strengthened capacities to advocate and to increase people's voice in decisions on policies regarding agriculture production systems, land scape management and market systems
local communities, CBOs and small holder organisations that promote innovative locally owned solutions, recognizing and promoting gender equality and women and youth leadership
